Ricky Holtz

Designer, developer, and graduate student at the UC Berkeley School of Information. On a mission to make great products and build a better web.

Skills

product design

I'm interested in the process, aesthetics, and human factors that go into awesome products.

front-end development

Nothing is more fulfilling (or more zen) than turning a concept into a functioning application.

research & writing

I know my users, communicate their needs, and create useful and lasting documentation.

Projects

aesthetic notes

When I review articles I've saved from the web, systems like Evernote focus on text. I designed an aesthetic-based concept for collections that puts images first. read more... about the aesthetic note project

url shortener

I wanted to learn more about the full web stack and associated protocols, so my friend and I went ahead and built an oddball url shortener called Crisco. read more... about the url shortener project

nickvision

Nickelodeon is a household name - but my team was tasked with adding value to the brand. We proposed an augmented reality experience called Nickvision. read more...about nickvision, an augmented reality application concept
